edu.um.suffix_trie

Interface SuffixTrie

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    OptimizedSuffixTrieImpl, SuffixTrieImpl

    public interface SuffixTrie
    Created by dylan on 02/12/2016. A edu.um.SuffixTrie.SuffixTrie is an ordered rooted tree where each edge is labelled with a unique letter from an alphabet. A Node has at most one receiving edge labelled. Keys (collection of words) are spelled out along some path starting from the root and ending with a terminal character(~).

    • Method Detail

      • buildSuffixTrie

        void buildSuffixTrie(java.lang.String word)
        Build the Suffix Trie.
        Parameters:
        word - The given word

      • substring

        boolean substring(java.lang.String word)
        Checks if the given string is a substring of the Suffix Trie.
        Parameters:
        word - Given word to compare.
        Returns:
        True if the word is a substring, false otherwise.

      • suffix

        boolean suffix(java.lang.String word)
        A suffix of a string is a substring that occurs at the end of the Suffix Trie. The path for the word is traversed and the leaf is checked to see if it contains the terminal character.
        Parameters:
        word - Given word to compare.
        Returns:
        True if the word is a suffix, false otherwise.

      • count

        int count(java.lang.String word)
        Count how many times word appears in the Suffix Trie. This is done by following the path of the given word starting from the head. The leaves under the node are the number of occurrences.
        Parameters:
        word - Given word to count.
        Returns:
        The number of occurrences.

      • longestRepeat

        java.lang.String longestRepeat()
        Find the longest repeated substring in the Suffix Trie by finding the deepest node with more than one child.
        Returns:
        The longest repeated substring. Empty String if there are no repeated substring.

      • longestSubstring

        java.lang.String longestSubstring(java.lang.String givenWord)
        Finds the longest common substring between the given word and Suffix Trie. To accomplish this first traverse the given list. If the given list is traversed, return it since it is the longest substring. If a dead end is found, the suffix link on the current traverse string is used. The current string is also added to the list. When using the suffix link, the the tail of the current string is taken as the new current String and the Suffix Trie is traversed from the root. If the current String is empty, there is no suffix link and thus the character from the given word is removed. The above steps are repeated until the given word is empty. The longest string is returned.
        Parameters:
        givenWord - The word to compare with the edu.um.SuffixTrie.SuffixTrie.
        Returns:
        The longest substring.

      • show

        void show()
        Display Suffix Trie. Style inspired by linux tree folder structure command.
